intro: Rogeria adenophylla subsp. rosea, commonly known as the rose-flowered rogeria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences. The plant features lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of pink to purple flowers. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens or containers. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and by horticulturists.
